chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alyssa N. Sauceda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

miscConds.notes:
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or schooling as approved by the Agent
--shall not provide any child care for any child, except as authorized by any existing juvenile court order
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offenders except as authorized by DOC

--comply with any other treatment, therapy or counseling or assessments as directed by DOC
--comply with all terms and conditions of any existing juvenile court orders
--to submit DNA sample

Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 9:20am [ma]
Defendant Alyssa N. Sauceda in court with attorney John Vernon Rhiel.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

ADA Shock submits victim impact statement
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--engage in any mental health counseling
--comply with any other treatment, therapy or counseling or assessments as directed by DOC
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or schooling as approved by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offenders except as authorized by DOC
--comply with all terms and conditions of any existing juvenile court orders
--shall not provide any child care for any child, except as authorized by any existing juvenile court order
--to pay statutory costs
--to submit DNA sample 

Days credit for time already served:  1 days
recess:9:38am
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch 4
Case called at 3: 06pm  (tn) 

Defendant Alyssa N. Sauceda in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rhiel notifies the Court that there is a related Children's Court matter. He is requesting additonal time to have a psychological profile completed. 
The Defendant has a follow-up appointment with the psychologist in 2 days and believes a report could be completed and filed in 3 weeks and hopes to have a plea agreement both sides can work with.  He believes the outcome of the pyschological profile may impact the plea negotiations in this case. 

The Court and Counsel discuss concerns about the age of the case.
ADA Shock would not object to one more extension if less than 30 days 


Court requests the minutes reflect that if the report is not completed or agreement is not reached by the time of the next hearing then  the case should then be scheduled for trial. 
Court continues Bond in this case 


Recess: 3:10 pm 
NEXT : Status Conference 9/23/2016 at 10:00 am
Status conference on August 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Case called at 1:52 pm [sf]
Defendant Alyssa N. Sauceda in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert appearing for Attorney John Rhiel. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Dahnert advises that the defendant was mistaken about the court time and that Ms Sauceda advised that she did wait for awhile.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court reinstates the signature bond.

Recess: 1:55 pm

NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing scheduled for 5/20/16 at 8:30 am - send notices

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV 
[MK] case called at 8:40am. 
Attorney John V Rhiel in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today.
Attorney Rhiel does not have an explanation for the non-appearance of Defendant Alyssa Sauceda.  He is aware that she has lost her housing; she either left or is unable to stay with her parents.  Attorney Rhiel requests the stay of any warrant.
The Court orders issuance of a Warrant.  The Court does not forfeit the bail at this point. 
recess 8:41am.

[[Clerks Note: Ms. Sauceda did appear at approximately 10:15am, the Judge informed her that we would get to her case in a moment; Ms. Sauceda exited the Courtroom, when there was a break in the court proceedings clerk mo looked for Ms. Sauceda in the hallways, DA's office and COC and was unable to locate Ms. Sauceda/ mo]]
Preliminary hearing on May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 11:10am. 
Defendant Alyssa N. Sauceda in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rhiel indicates that he is continuing to have case discussions with ADA Beck, however at this point ADA Hall has indicated that the State's position is that the case should be scheduled next for Preliminary Hearing.
